greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations p of [n] such that 0p has a nonincreasing jump sequence beginning with k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: An up-jump j occurs at position i in p if p_{i} > p_{i-1} and j is the index of p_i in the increasingly sorted list of those elements in {p_{i}, ..., p_{n}} that are larger than p_{i-1}. A down-jump j occurs at position i in p if p_{i} < p_{i-1} and j is the index of p_i in the decreasingly sorted list of those elements in {p_{i}, ..., p_{n}} that are smaller than p_{i-1}. First index in the lists is 1 here.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(u+o=0, 1,
mathematica: b[u_, o_, t_] := b[u, o, t] = If[u + o == 0, 1, Sum[b[u - j, o + j - 1, j], {j, 1, Min[t, u]}] + Sum[b[u + j - 1, o - j, j], {j, 1, Min[t, o]}]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 09 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Row sums and T(n+1,n+1) give A291685.
T(2n,n) gives A291688, T(2n+1,n+1) gives A303203, T(n,ceiling(n/2)) gives A303204.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 29 2017
